result.execSummary:
The defendant John T Taylor Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Incest, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.06.
  • Incest, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.06.
  • Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court will allow the State 60 days to determined if there is any restitution.  

Per restitution order:  Restitution determined to be $0.

Pay costs on each count.  Pay one DNA surcharge.
Pay $93.75 for genetic testing under costs in this case. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Work full time go to school full time or combination thereof, unless he is 100% disabled and cannot work and he has proof thereof.

No contact with the victim A.S. or her family.
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without the prior approval of his agents. Except with his son, if approved by the department and if chaperoned.
Needs to be in presence of an appropriate adult charpone.
Court will allow written communication with his son, if approved by the DOC.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

Submit a DNA sample, if not already done so. 
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor his case. 
Remain in compliance with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry program. 
Successfully participate in the Sex Offender Treatment program. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by his agent.

records.addlTxt: for Counts 1 & 7 with attached supporting documentation
for Count 1 & 7
from ADA E.C. to Branch 3 Judge dated 09/08/16 in re:  Act 355 passed by the State Legislature in April of 2016 with attached supporting documentation

Defendant John T Taylor appeared by phone from Racine Correctional Institute.. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin.

11:34 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

This is before the Court by the request of the Defendant.

Defendant is serving a sentence and he wrote a letter to the Court.
Court considers this a motion.

Defendant is requesting the money not come from his prison account.

There is a change in the law where 50% can be taken out of the account now.

Defendant states that too much money is being taken out of his paychecks.
Defendant states that 60% is being taken out. 

Defendant is requesting that any money owed, to be put off until extended supervision begins.  
Defendant will be on 8 years of extended supervision.

Atty Constable addresses the Court, did confer with the prison as well and was directed to Act 355.
State is unaware if costs can be put off by request.

Court questions Atty Constable.
Atty Constable states that the administrative code was filed with the Court.

Court addresses the parties.
Inmate trust system deductions is referred to. These are mandatory deductions and institution is required by administrative code/statutes to do this. There is nothing the Court needs to do.  

Court does not have authority to grant the request if Court chose to do.
from DOC dated 09/12/16 in re:  Inmate Trust System Deductions
e-mail correspondence from ADA Elizabeth Constable to Br 3
Review hearing on October 10, 2016 at 11:30 am.
letter from Defendant dated 08/20/16
Review hearing on September 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Sentencing hearing held March 25, 2015

Defendant John T Taylor in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant John T Taylor in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:43 a.m.  Court calls the case. 
Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  No corrections. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 
State files written Victim Statements.  Court reviews. 
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kryshak makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - 
8 years prison with 4 years initial confinement followed by 4 years extended supervision.
Count 2 - 
8 years prison with 4 years initial confinement followed by 4 years extended supervision, Consecutive to Count 1.
Count 7 -
8 years prison with 4 years initial confinement followed by 4 years extended supervision, Concurrent to Counts 1 & 2.
386 days credit. 
Conditions: 
Submit a DNA sample, if not already done so. 
Pay one DNA surcharge. 
Pay costs on each count.
Any costs or DNA surcharges at 25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Work full time go to school full time or combination thereof, unless he is 100% disabled and cannot work and he has proof thereof.
No contact with the victim A.S. or her family.
No contact with anyone under the age of 18 without the prior approval of his agents. Except with his son, if approved by the department and if chaperoned.
Needs to be in presence of an appropriate adult charpone.
Court will allow written communication with his son, if approved by the DOC.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Sign necessary releases so agent can monitor his case. 
Court will allow the State 60 days to determined if there is any restitution.  
Pay $93.75 for genetic testing under costs in this case. 
Remain in compliance with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry program. 
Successfully participate in the Sex Offender Treatment program. 
Engage in any other counseling deemed appropriate by his agent.
Sentencing hearing on March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on March 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant John T Taylor in court with attorney Gary J. Kryshak. Defendant John T Taylor in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF105, 14CF141

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with victim notification statutes. 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
14CF105 Counts 1, 2 and 7 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2 and 7.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 3 thru 6 in 14CF105 are dismissed and read-in. 
14CF141 is dismissed and read-in in its entirety. 
Court orders a PSI. 
PSI to be completed and copies forwarded to parties no later than 2/20/15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

for Genetic Tests
Motion hearing on July 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gary J Kryshak in court. Defendant, John T Taylor, Sr., does not appear.  Veronica F Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:42 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Isherwood states the appearances.
Atty Kryshak makes statements regarding  the Motion Hearing and that it is for DNA Testing.
Atty Isherwood makes statements regarding the DNA Testing and status of the case.
Atty Kryshak makes additional statements.
Court reviews the elements of the crime.
Atty Isherwood makes statements that the Defendant had sexual contact with the victim after she turned 18 knowing she was related by blood.
Atty Kryshak makes statements regarding if the victim is biologically the defendant's daughter and incest had occurred.
Atty Isherwood states that the Defendant is indicating that he is the father of the victim; Atty Kryshak makes statement regarding statute.

BY THE COURT:
Court would like the parties to provide a Memorandum of Law and if a similar case exists.
Memorandum of Law to be provided by both parties by July 14, 2014.
New hearing set for July 28, 2014 at 8:30 a.m. 

Court questions why the defendant had not been brought over for the hearing.
Atty Kryshak indicates that he waived the defendants appearance.
